citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The semi-annual report to the Institutional Officer (IO) in January 2023 does not discuss reviewing the facility's program
for humane care and use of animals or reasonable and specific plans with scheduled dates for correcting each deficiency
identified during inspection of the animal facilities. The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) performed
their semi-annual program review in December of 2022 but no outcome of the program review was relayed to the facility's
IO in their semi-annual report. During the December 2022 semi-annual facility inspection, 6 minor deficiencies were
noted. The letter to the IO states that a few minor deficiencies were found but all were corrected quickly by the Primary
Investigators (PI). The letter does not include each minor deficiency with a reasonable and specific plan and schedule
with dates for correcting each deficiency.
Notifying the IO of the results of each semi-annual program and facility review performed by the IACUC is important to
ensure the IO is aware of the status of the facility and can monitor the activities of the IACUC.
Correct by June 14, 2023 by ensuring the report detailing the IACUC's semi-annual evaluations contains the results of
reviewing the program for human care and use of animals and the facility inspection, including any deficiencies and a
reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting each deficiency.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
